alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 10:50PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by overnight rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Areas in and around Yosemite National Park including El Portal and Crane Flat Campground. * WHEN...Until 145 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Please do not cross any flooded roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1047 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Portal and Crane Flat Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
